intro: Paederia pallida, commonly known as the pale paederia, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, producing a subtle fragrance. Paederia pallida is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives as a woody climber.
